snippet: Judge Raymond J. Dearie ordered the office to produce a report on how often unapproved gag orders have been included in past subpoenas.
abstract: Federal Judge Raymond J Dearie orders United States attorney's office in Brooklyn, which issued subpoena for financial records of Queens pizzeria owners Gregorio and Eleonora Gigliotti, to explain why subpoena included language forbidding Gigliottis' accountants from informing their clients it had been issued; lawyers for Gigliottis, who are charged with running international drug ring out of pizzeria, say language prohibiting disclosure of subpoena to couple is illegal.

keywords.value: Cucino a Modo Mio (Queens, NY, Restaurant)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Judge Raymond J. Dearie ordered the office to produce a report on how often unapproved gag orders have been included in past subpoenas.

headline.print_headline: Judge Faults Prosecutor for Order in Drug Inquiry
headline.main: Judge Finds Fault With Gag Order in U.S. Attorney’s Subpoena
